author: @hawaiinewsnow
title: ‚ÄòIt was a poor decision‚Äô: Bodybuilding couple arrested after aiming guns at day care, police say
text:
MIAMI-DADE COUNTY, Fla. (WSVN) ‚Äì A couple was arrested after causing a scare outside a day care facility in South Florida.
Estrella Maria Pereira, who was one of the accused, said the two didn‚Äôt realize there was a day care near where they were pulling a publicity stunt.
‚ÄúIt was a poor decision,‚Äù she said.
Pereira and Miguel Ruiz were seen taking two rifles out of a Corvette before aiming it directly at the Devon Aire Kiddy College in Miami-Dade County.
Pereira now says they made a mistake.
‚ÄúReally, we‚Äôre not bad people, we will never harm anyone or anything,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre bodybuilders and we‚Äôre into the social media thing, Youtube Channel, you know, Instagram so forth, and he thought it would be cool to take a picture with a gun, because with muscles and guns, and it sounds really cool, like if you look at a photograph like that.‚Äù
The incident was supposed to be a photoshoot, according to Pereira, but it put the day care on lockdown and alarmed many parents.
‚ÄúWe did everything in our power to protect the children that are here in the facility and we followed every measure to stay safe,‚Äù an unnamed day care said.
Pereira has since been bailed out, while Ruiz is still being held in custody.
What began as a publicity stunt is now causing the two to be faced with serious charges.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs ridiculous,‚Äù Pereira said. ‚ÄúAnd yes, it is getting blown out of proportion. But I do understand the severity, and how it could scare somebody, because I would be freaked out if I saw somebody doing the same thing, I‚Äôd be freaked out.‚Äù
Ruiz and Pereira have been ordered to stay away from the woman who called police and the day care center.
Copyright 2024 WSVN via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved.

author: @100percFEDUP
title: United Kingdom Supreme Court Delivers Common Sense Ruling On Transgender Debate * 100PercentFedUp.com * by
text:
The Supreme Court of the United Kingdom delivered a common sense ruling on the transgender debate, unanimously stating that a woman is someone born biologically female.
As a physician, I deal in biology‚Äînot ideology.
The UK Supreme Court just ruled what every doctor knows: a woman is defined by biology.
You can‚Äôt change your biological sex. Gender isn‚Äôt something you self-define.
This isn‚Äôt bigotry. It‚Äôs reality.
[pic.twitter.com/Hn9SIPgeUo]
‚Äî Dr. Simone Gold (@drsimonegold)
[April 16, 2025] Fox News reports:
Trans women can be excluded from some single-sex spaces and groups under the U.K. Equality Act, the five judges of the top court ruled. These spaces and groups include changing rooms, homeless shelters, swimming areas and medical or counseling services provided only to women.
The ruling means that even a transgender person with a certificate that recognizes them as female should not be considered a woman for equality purposes.
But Justice Patrick Hodge said its ruling ‚Äúdoes not remove protection from trans people,‚Äù who are ‚Äúprotected from discrimination on the ground of gender reassignment.‚Äù
‚ÄúInterpreting ‚Äòsex‚Äô as certificated sex would cut across the definitions of ‚Äòman‚Äô and ‚Äòwoman‚Äô ‚Ä¶ and, thus, the protected characteristic of sex in an incoherent way,‚Äù Hodge said. ‚ÄúIt would create heterogeneous groupings.‚Äù
Women‚Äôs rights groups celebrated the ruling outside the court.
üö®New: The UK Supreme Court has ruled trans women are not legally biological women
Congratulations
[@jk_rowling] [pic.twitter.com/VF4hYfFwoA]
‚Äî The Calvin Coolidge Project (@TheCalvinCooli1)
[April 16, 2025]
WATCH:
UK Supreme Court just ruled that law defines women as people born biologically female.
This is a huge win for women, men, and sanity in the UK and the West.
Now every country needs to get onboard and recognize in law what is a woman.
Congratulations to UK women!
[pic.twitter.com/nJU0zQvIgl]
‚Äî Paul A. Szypula üá∫üá∏ (@Bubblebathgirl)
[April 16, 2025]
Per
BBC:
The court sided with campaign group For Women Scotland, which brought a case against the Scottish government arguing that sex-based protections should only apply to people that are born female.
Judge Lord Hodge said the ruling should not be seen as a triumph of one side over the other, and stressed that the law still gives protection against discrimination to transgender people.
The Scottish government argued in court that transgender people with a gender recognition certificate (GRC) are entitled to the same sex-based protections as biological women.
The Supreme Court was asked to decide on the proper interpretation of the 2010 Equality Act, which applies across Britain.
Lord Hodge said the central question was how the words ‚Äúwoman‚Äù and ‚Äúsex‚Äù are defined in the legislation.
He told the court: ‚ÄúThe unanimous decision of this court is that the terms woman and sex in the Equality Act 2010 refer to a biological woman and biological sex.
‚ÄúBut we counsel against reading this judgement as a triumph of one or more groups in our society at the expense of another, it is not.‚Äù
He added that the legislation gives transgender people ‚Äúprotection, not only against discrimination through the protected characteristic of gender reassignment, but also against direct discrimination, indirect discrimination and harassment in substance in their acquired gender‚Äù.

author: ExpressDigest
title: Hiker found alive after 10 days lost in California mountains reveals how he survived
text:
A shirtless hiker who went missing for 10 days in remote northern California mountains has been found alive despite having no water and not telling anyone where he was going.
Lukas McClish, 34, had set out on a three-hour hike through the Big Basin Redwoods State Park in Boulder Creek, California, on June 11 after his friend mentioned a granite outcropping in the area.
He did not tell anyone where he was going, and had brought with him just a few supplies because he is an experienced hiker who has traversed other rugged regions of the US.
‚ÄòI left with a pair of pants, and my hiking shoes and a hat,‚Äô McClish told KGO-TV. ‚ÄòI had a flashlight and a air of folding scissors, like a Leatherman tool ‚Äì and that was about it.‚Äô
McClish, an experienced hiker who does landscaping in forests razed by wildfires, said he was ‚Äòastounded‚Äô that he got lost ‚Äì and so quickly. The alarm was only raised by his parents when he failed to turn up for lunch on father‚Äôs day.
Before he was rescued he spent nine nights and 10 days ‚Äì shirtless ‚Äì foraging for himself as he drank water from the creek, ate wild berries and slept on wet leaves, losing around 2.5st (30lbs) in weight.
Things got worse on day eight when he came down with hypothermia and slipped while going over a rock face. So decided to shout: ‚ÄòHelp, help, I‚Äôm over here‚Äô for around 48 hours before several of the 300 rangers searching for him heard him.
A drone was sent up and he was quickly found with the help of a sniffer dog. And remarkably he only needed one night in hospital before he could return home to his family, who had been waiting for him at the forest‚Äôs edge when he was rescued.
Lukas McClish, 34, was rescued from the Big Basin Redwoods State Park in Boulder Creek, California after 10 days
The moment that Mr McClish was reunited him with his family (pic
McClish said he initially considered the predicament a chance to test his survival skills
The area in which he was hiking had been razed in the CZU Lightning Complex fire of 2020 and ‚Äòlooks completely different from all of the other terrain,‚Äô he explained.
‚ÄòThat‚Äôs one thing I didn‚Äôt take into consideration ‚Äì when the fire comes through like that and decimates it, it turns into the desert and you‚Äôre unable to find your bearings.‚Äô
The typical markers to indicate direction, such as deer trails or hiking paths, were gone.
But at first, McClish considered his predicament a chance to test his survival skills, according to the New York Times.
‚ÄòI‚Äôm an avid backpacker, so for me to go out for a night or two is not out of the norm,‚Äô he told the Times.
On that first cold night, though, McClish tried to build himself a camp ‚Äì but the brush he used to start a fire was wet.
He then hiked across a canyon for better shelter, and the next day set out to find a stream he thought would be nearby.
‚ÄòSo I just kind of hiked,‚Äô McClish told WDBJ. ‚ÄòEach day I go up a canyon, down a canyon, to the next waterfall, drank water out of my boot.‚Äô
‚ÄòI felt comfortable every time I was out there,‚Äô he said. ‚ÄòI wasn‚Äôt worried about it.‚Äô
‚ÄòI had a mountain lion that was following me, but it was cool,‚Äô McClish added. ‚ÄòIt kept its distance.
‚ÄòI think it was just somebody watching over me.‚Äô
The Big Basin Redwoods State Park was hit by a wildfire in August that burned roughly 97 percent of the parks 18,224 acres
His parents grew worried when he did not show up for Fathers‚Äô Day and filed a missing persons report
But by day five, McClish started to grow concerned ‚Äì and tried to find a way back to civilization.
‚ÄòI knew if I kept following the sun, I‚Äôd get to the ocean eventually, but I didn‚Äôt know how far from the ocean I was,‚Äô he said.
Meanwhile, his family began to worry when he did not show up for Father‚Äôs Day, and filed a missing person‚Äôs report.
That sparked a massive manhunt, involving nearly 300 people and emergency personnel from several agencies.
‚ÄòSome nights, although I just had to trust God that he was going to be OK ‚Äì and that was hard to do some nights, when we would go to bed at night, because I would worry about where he was, where he was sleeping, how cold he was and where he was if he was alive,‚Äô his mother, Diane McClish, told WDBJ.
The missing persons report sparked a massive, nearly 300-person manhunt for the missing hiker
McClish was finally found when park rangers heard his cries for help
As search efforts continued, McClish started shouting for help as he experienced hypothermia and slipped while going over a rock face.
‚ÄòHelp, help, I‚Äôm over here,‚Äô he remembers screaming over and over during days eight and nine, along with ‚ÄòIs anybody out there?‚Äô
At the same time, McClish said he kept dreaming about his next meal as he was forced to survive on wild berries.
‚ÄòI wanted a burrito or a taco bowl,‚Äô he said. ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs what I thought about every day when I, after the first five days, when I started to kind of realize that I might be in over my head.‚Äô
Finally, at around 7.30pm on Thursday, two park rangers were making their way up a hill and heard McClish‚Äôs screams.
‚ÄòI‚Äôm thinking, I hope this isn‚Äôt a mirage,‚Äô McClish recounted.
The Boulder Creek Fire Department deployed a drone and spotted him, while a dog tracked him down
But the Boulder Creek Fire Department soon deployed a drone and spotted him, while a dog tracked him down.
He was then escorted out of the wilderness by police, and was reunited with his anxious family.
McClish would go on to spend Thursday night safely at a local hospital, where doctors removed rocks from his back.
He said he still doesn‚Äôt fear the wilderness, but admitted: ‚ÄòI did enough hiking for probably the whole rest of the year.‚Äô
***
Read more at DailyMail.co.uk

author: VNExplorer
title: ¬øAdi√≥s √≥rganos aut√≥nomos? Reformas constitucionales de AMLO se votar√°n en septiembre
text: Foto: (Especial) En conferencia de prensa, Ignacio Mier, coordinador del grupo parlamentario de Morena en la C√°mara de Diputados, anunci√≥ que las 18 reformas constitucionales propuestas por el presidente Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador (AMLO) en febrero de este a√±o ser√°n sometidas a votaci√≥n en septiembre. El diputado indic√≥ que las reformas se votar√°n mediante una nueva mayor√≠a calificada, lo que implica que se necesitar√° el apoyo de al menos dos tercios de los legisladores presentes para su aprobaci√≥n, de concretarse el triunfo de Morena en las pasadas elecciones (372 diputados de 500 y 83 de 128 senadores), esto ya no ser√≠a una preocupaci√≥n para el partido oficial al menos en la c√°mara baja, pero en el Senado todav√≠a tendr√≠an que convencer a algunos legisladores de oposici√≥n. En ese sentido, se mencion√≥ que la Comisi√≥n de Puntos Constitucionales de la C√°mara de Diputados ya se encuentra trabajando en los dict√°menes correspondientes para cada una de las reformas. Entre las reformas que se destacan en este paquete de 18 propuestas, se encuentran la Reforma Judicial, la Reforma Militar, la Reforma Electoral y la desaparici√≥n de √≥rganos aut√≥nomos como el Instituto Nacional de Transparencia, Acceso a la Informaci√≥n y Protecci√≥n de Datos Personales (INAI). ¬øCu√°les son las reformas de AMLO? La Reforma Judicial tiene como objetivo principal modificar la estructura y funcionamiento del Poder Judicial, con miras a hacerlo m√°s eficiente y accesible para los ciudadanos, adem√°s de que los ministros de la Suprema Corte de Justicia de la Naci√≥n sean elegidos por voto popular. En el caso de la Reforma Militar se pretende redefinir el papel de las Fuerzas Armadas en la seguridad p√∫blica, ampliando su participaci√≥n en tareas de seguridad ciudadana y pasar de lleno el mando de la Guardia Nacional a la Secretar√≠a de la Defensa Nacional (Sedena). Por otro lado, la Reforma Electoral incluye modificaciones en la organizaci√≥n y funcionamiento del Instituto Nacional Electoral (INE) como que los consejeros sean elegidos tambi√©n por voto popular y contempla la disminuci√≥n de plurinominales. Finalmente, una de las reformas m√°s controvertidas es la desaparici√≥n de √≥rganos aut√≥nomos. Esta medida ha sido criticada por diversos sectores, quienes argumentan que podr√≠a representar un retroceso en materia de transparencia y acceso a la informaci√≥n si se llega a desaparecer el INAI. Paquete original de reformas Reconocimiento de los pueblos ind√≠genas y afromexicanos. Garantizar la pensi√≥n para adultos mayores y el aumento de √©sta cada a√±o; as√≠ como la atenci√≥n para personas con discapacidad. Otorgar becas a estudiantes de bajos recursos en todos los niveles escolares. Garantizar atenci√≥n m√©dica integral y gratuita a la poblaci√≥n. Garantizar la vivienda de los trabajadores. Prohibir el maltrato de animales. Prohibici√≥n del fracking y no otorgar concesiones para la actividad minera a cielo abierto. Respetar las zonas con escasez de agua y s√≥lo otorgar concesiones para uso dom√©stico. Prohibir el comercio de vapeadores y drogas qu√≠micas como el fentanilo. Aumentar el salario m√≠nimo por encima de la inflaci√≥n anual. Que el salario m√≠nimo de maestros, polic√≠as, marinos, enfermeras, m√©dicos, entre otros trabajadores de gobierno, no sea menor al de trabajadores inscritos al seguro social. Revertir las reformas a las pensiones aprobadas en 1997 y 2007 por los presidentes Ernesto Zedillo y Felipe Calder√≥n. Garantizar el derecho a la educaci√≥n y al trabajo. Brindar seguro a campesinos que cultivan sus tierras y mantener programas de apoyo directo a la producci√≥n. Utilizar 18,000 kil√≥metros de v√≠as f√©rreas para trenes de pasajeros y devolver a la Comisi√≥n Federal de Electricidad su car√°cter de empresa p√∫blica estrat√©gica. Reducci√≥n de gastos electorales, disminuci√≥n a 64 senadores y 300 diputados, y reducir a 30% de participaci√≥n para que las consultas populares sean vinculantes. Elecci√≥n de jueces, magistrados y ministros por voto popular. Integrar la Guardia Nacional a la Secretar√≠a de la Defensa Nacional para evitar corrupci√≥n. Establecer en la Constituci√≥n que ning√∫n servidor p√∫blico puede ganar m√°s que el presidente de la Rep√∫blica. Eliminar los √≥rganos aut√≥nomos.

Homofobia, racismo, nostalgia por Benito Mussolini, simpat√≠as por Adolf Hitler...

author: Patrick Ryan
title: Donald Trump denies he 'bullied' his way into 'Home Alone 2' movie
text: Donald Trump insists his cameo made 'Home Alone 2' a success: 'I was, and still am, great' [Patrick Ryan](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/2646682001/patrick-ryan/) Donald Trump wants you to know that he‚Äôs no Grinch. Sure, [he once told a 7-year-old boy](/story/news/politics/2018/12/24/donald-trump-tells-child-its-marginal-still-believe-santa-clause/2410738002/) that believing in Santa is ‚Äúmarginal.‚Äù But the former president insists he was nothing but gracious on the set of [‚ÄúHome Alone 2: Lost in New York,‚Äù](/story/entertainment/movies/2023/12/22/home-alone-movies-ranked/72012545007/) after the film‚Äôs director claimed that Trump forced his way into a cameo. On Wednesday, Trump addressed his blink-and-you'll-miss-it role in the 1992 comedy [in a lengthy post on Truth Social](https://twitter.com/DrewSav/status/1740121012455272756), his social-media platform. ‚ÄúDirector Chris Columbus, and others, were begging me to make a cameo appearance in ‚ÄòHome Alone 2,‚Äô ‚Äù Trump wrote. ‚ÄúThey rented the Plaza Hotel in New York, which I owned at the time. I was very busy, and didn‚Äôt want to do it. They were very nice, but above all, persistent. I agreed, and the rest is history! ‚ÄúThat little cameo took off like a rocket and the movie was a big success, and still is, especially around Christmastime,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúPeople call me whenever it is aired.‚Äù Columbus recently told [Business Insider](https://www.insider.com/home-alone-30-anniversary-chris-columbus-trump-cameo-2020-11) that in addition to a standard shooting fee, Trump would only let them use the Plaza if he could make a cameo. ‚ÄúHe did bully his way into the movie,‚Äù Columbus said. ‚ÄúNothing could be further from the truth,‚Äù Trump wrote. ‚ÄúThat cameo helped make the movie a success, but if they felt bullied, or didn‚Äôt want me, why did they put me in, and keep me there, for over 30 years? Because I was, and still am, great for the movie, that‚Äôs why! Just another Hollywood guy from the past looking for a quick fix of Trump publicity for himself!‚Äù ‚ÄúHome Alone 2‚Äù made a whopping $359 million [at the worldwide box office](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt0104431/). It‚Äôs impossible to ever truly know how much of that was fueled by Trump‚Äôs six-second, one-line cameo. Merry Christmas, ya filthy animals: [Every 'Home Alone' movie, definitively ranked](/story/entertainment/movies/2023/12/22/home-alone-movies-ranked/72012545007/)
